wikipedia_page.main: Ronald James Adams (8 March 1916 – 12 April 2004) was a British rally driver from Belfast.

response: | Ronnie Adams / Frank Biggar (EI)/ Derek Johnston (GB/Northern Ireland)
* Ronnie Adams, winner of the 1956 Monte Carlo Rally in a Jaguar Mark VII and first winner of the Circuit of Ireland Rally in 1936
In January 1956 a Mark VII M driven by Ronnie Adams, Frank Biggar, and Derek Johnstone won the Monte Carlo Rally.

Davey Allison would become the lowest-finishing driver to complete the event; he and the Ranier team mostly skipped the short track races in 1987 but chose to enter the #28 Havoline Ford in this one just to get short track experience before running a full schedule in 1988.Driver Davey Allison 1987 NASCAR Winston Cup Series Results at Racing Reference The team treated the event as a de facto test session, bringing the #28 T-Bird behind the wall on purpose a few times to make major adjustments (like changing all the springs) before sending Davey back out to get more experience. Hut Stricklin would be involved in a crash on lap 207 that knocked him out of the race. Drivers who failed to make the grid were Glenn Moffat, Lynn Gibson, J.D. McDuffie (#70), Bobby Gerhart, Kevin Evans (#54), Joe Dan Bailey (#36), D. Wayne Strout (#97), Ronnie Adams (#38), Bill Hollar, Graham Taylor, Brandon Baker (#88), Clark James and Rodney Combs.Qualifying information at Racing Reference
